creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-08-08T18:58:06</date>

unittitle.value: Records of the King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center

abstract.value: The King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center promotes research and teaching on Spain and the Spanish-speaking world at New York University. The Records of the King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center contains a 2011 publication, <emph render="italic">Centelles in_edit_¡oh!</emph>, related to a photography exhibition of Spanish journalist Agustí Centelles Ossó. This exhibition was jointly sponsored by the Spanish Ministry of Culture and the King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center at NYU.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Records of the King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center; RG 37.33; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Transferred in June 2019. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.076.

In April 1997, in the presence of distinguished figures from Spain, Latin America, and the U.S., including the King and Queen of Spain and First Lady Hillary Rodham Clinton, the King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center was inaugurated. It promised to be the most comprehensive university-based resource of its sort. Housed in Judson Hall, the Washington Square Park landmark building designed by Stanford White, the Center solidified NYU's commitment to the study of Spain and Latin America. Unexpectedly, it also quickly became a major cultural resource for the city of New York, educating many in the community who might not be exposed to the cultures and history of Spain and Latin America.

This collection contains a 2011 publication, <emph render="italic">Centelles in_edit_¡oh!</emph>, related to a photography exhibition of Spanish journalist Agustí Centelles Ossó. This exhibition was jointly sponsored by the Spanish Ministry of Culture and the King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center at NYU.
